thread.title: Matheny debunks prediction of Cards as 76-86 team
thread.title_full: Matheny debunks prediction of Cards as 76-86 team

author: Rick Hummel St. Louis Post-Dispatch
title: Matheny debunks prediction of Cards as 76-86 team

organizations.name: close chris lee  st. louis cardinals

text:
Close Chris Lee 
St. Louis Cardinals manager Mike Matheny in the dugout during a game between the St. Louis Cardinals and the Pittsburgh Pirates on Saturday, Oct. 1, 2016, at Busch Stadium in St. Louis. Photo by Chris Lee, Matheny debunks prediction of Cards as 76-86 team By Rick Hummel St. Louis Post-Dispatch Feb 10, 2017 11 min ago Chris Lee 
St. Louis Cardinals manager Mike Matheny in the dugout during a game between the St. Louis Cardinals and the Pittsburgh Pirates on Saturday, Oct. 1, 2016, at Busch Stadium in St. Louis. Photo by Chris Lee, clee@post-dispatch.com TownNews.com Content Exchange 
JUPITER, Fla • Before Cardinals manager Mike Matheny departed for Columbus, Ohio, and daughter Katie’s Senior Weekend hockey games for the Lady Buckeyes, he stopped in Friday to meet with and observe some of his players who were working out ahead of Tuesday’s first official workout day for pitchers and catchers. 
After shaking a few hands and slapping a few backs, Matheny went into his office for a bit and offered a strong opposing view to a recent Baseball Prospectus prediction that assessed the 2017 Cardinals as a less than mediocre team that would finish with a 76-86 record, or a reverse of their final mark for 2016. The former record would only tie Milwaukee for third place in the National League Central Division standings, well behind the Chicago Cubs and even the Pittsburgh Pirates. 
The PECOTA system, which stands for Player Empirical Comparison and Optimization Test Algorithm, correctly projected all five National League playoff teams (the Cardinals weren’t one) last year. 
But Matheny, who had been doing his reading, said, “That’s unbelievable. Yeah, I saw it. I hope the guys saw it, too. I’m not going to make a big deal of it, though. 
“I’m not going to beat up what the rest of the world is saying _ trying to prove everybody wrong,” said Matheny. “I just want to make sure our guys take a good look around and see what we really are and what we have. 
“We’ve got guys who are motivated. Guys have an edge as to how it finished last year. We’ve got the makings of a fun, fun season.”
